snippet: The Tallahassee police initially labeled an accident involving a Florida State football player as a hit and run, a criminal act, but later decided to issue him two traffic tickets, an examination by The New York Times found.
abstract: Review of law enforcement records and interviews with people involved in car accident involving Florida State University cornerback P J Williams finds that Williams was given break by Tallahassee police; police initially labeled accident a hit and run, but later decided to issue Williams two traffic tickets; accident comes amid heightened national scrutiny of preferential treatment given to athletes.

byline.original: By MIKE McINTIRE and WALT BOGDANICH

lead_paragraph: The Tallahassee police initially labeled an accident involving a Florida State football player as a hit and run, a criminal act, but later decided to issue him two traffic tickets, an examination by The New York Times found.

headline.main: Florida State Player Fled Crash but Got Only Traffic Tickets
headline.print_headline: Florida State Player Fled Crash but Got Only Traffic Tickets
